com.uttt.common

Class ArgCheck

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.uttt.common.ArgCheck

  • public class ArgCheck
extends java.lang.Object
    A static utility class providing standardized checking of method arguments, throwing meaningful / readable exceptions when the desired invariants are violated.

    All of the ArgCheck methods throw an IllegalArgumentException with a helpful message prefixed by a caller supplied definition identification. Typically, this is an argument name, but may be any useful string, e.g. "foo.getThing()".

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void index(java.lang.String name, int value, int size, java.lang.String sizeQualifier)
      Throws IllegalArgumentException if the supplied value is either negative, or not-less-than size.
      static void notNull(java.lang.String name, java.lang.Object value)
      Throws IllegalArgumentException if the supplied value is null.
      static void rangeClosed(java.lang.String name, int value, int lower, int upper)
      Throws IllegalArgumentException if the supplied value within the fully closed range, as specified by the lower and upper bounds.
      static void rangeClosedOpen(java.lang.String name, int value, int lower, int upper)
      Throws IllegalArgumentException if the supplied value within the half-closed range, as specified by the lower and upper bounds.

      • notNull

        public static void notNull(java.lang.String name,
                           java.lang.Object value)
        Throws IllegalArgumentException if the supplied value is null.
        Parameters:
        name - Definition identifcation within the caller's source code context, typically an argument name.
        value - The value being checked.

      • rangeClosed

        public static void rangeClosed(java.lang.String name,
                               int value,
                               int lower,
                               int upper)
        Throws IllegalArgumentException if the supplied value within the fully closed range, as specified by the lower and upper bounds.
        Parameters:
        name - Definition identifcation within the caller's source code context, typically an argument name.
        value - The value being checked.
        lower - The lower inclusive bound of the range
        upper - The upper inclusive bound of the range

      • rangeClosedOpen

        public static void rangeClosedOpen(java.lang.String name,
                                   int value,
                                   int lower,
                                   int upper)
        Throws IllegalArgumentException if the supplied value within the half-closed range, as specified by the lower and upper bounds.

        A very common usecase for this check is to validate an index against a size, as for an array or list. For that purpose, however, use ArgCheck.index(String, int, int) which better represents what the caller is verifying.

        Parameters:
        name - Definition identifcation within the caller's source code context, typically an argument name.
        value - The value being checked.
        lower - The lower inclusive bound of the range
        upper - The upper exclusive bound of the range

      • index

        public static void index(java.lang.String name,
                         int value,
                         int size,
                         java.lang.String sizeQualifier)
        Throws IllegalArgumentException if the supplied value is either negative, or not-less-than size. This is the canonical validation to use for array or list bounds checking, among others.
        Parameters:
        name - Definition identifcation within the caller's source code context, typically an argument name.
        value - The value being checked.
        size - The upper exclusive bound of the range
        sizeQualifier - An optional string that provides "identifier style" context to the size argument
